@goldsborough I meet the same problem today when I try to use the cpp api in my Macos. What I've done is:

  • Download the package from https://download.pytorch.org/libtorch/nightly/cpu/libtorch-macos-latest.zip;
  • Unzip it. And I got a "libtorch";
  • Then I copied the dir to "usr/local/include", which I put all the c++ packages I need.
  • Then I came back to CLION, changed its CMakeLists.txt as:
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.12)
project(torch_cpp_api_test)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 17)

find_package(Torch REQUIRED)

set(SOURCE_FILES main.cpp)

target_link_libraries(torch_cpp_api_test "${TORCH_LIBRARIES}")

add_executable(torch_cpp_api_test ${SOURCE_FILES})
  • And I got the sad message:
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:6 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindTorch.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
  asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "Torch", but
  CMake did not find one.

  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "Torch" with any of
  the following names:

    TorchConfig.cmake
    torch-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "Torch" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
  "Torch_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If "Torch"
  provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has been
  installed.

I really don't know how to do as I'm not very familiar with cmake.

New:
Finally I solved this problem by adding /path/to/libtorch to PATH.

body:
@goldsborough I meet the same problem today when I try to use the cpp api in my Macos. What I've done is:

- Download the package from  https://download.pytorch.org/libtorch/nightly/cpu/libtorch-macos-latest.zip;
- Unzip it. And I got a "libtorch";
- Then I copied the dir to "usr/local/include", which I put all the c++ packages I need.
- Then I came back to CLION, changed its CMakeLists.txt as:
```cmake
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.12)
project(torch_cpp_api_test)

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 17)

find_package(Torch REQUIRED)

set(SOURCE_FILES main.cpp)

target_link_libraries(torch_cpp_api_test "${TORCH_LIBRARIES}")

add_executable(torch_cpp_api_test ${SOURCE_FILES})
```
- And I got the sad message:
```cmake
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:6 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindTorch.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
  asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "Torch", but
  CMake did not find one.

  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "Torch" with any of
  the following names:

    TorchConfig.cmake
    torch-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "Torch" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
  "Torch_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If "Torch"
  provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has been
  installed.
```

I really don't know how to do as I'm not very familiar with cmake. 

---
---
---
 New:
Finally I solved this problem by adding /path/to/libtorch to PATH.
